newsitem.title: USA: Able Telcom to buy Georgia Electric Co.
newsitem.headline: Able Telcom to buy Georgia Electric Co.

text.p: Able Telcom Holding Corp said Thursday it had signed an agreement to buy Georgia Electric Co within the next 30 days.
Able Telcom said it expected the acquisition to have a "positive effect" on its net income and earnings per share.
It also said it expected to reach revenues on a consolidated basis of $75-$80 million, with improved operating margins, in fiscal 1997.
Able Telcom said the purchase price for Georgia Electric would be a cash amount and a five-year earn-out arrangement based on achieving certain pre-tax income and margins. It gave no details.
Georgia Electric, which will operate as a wholly owned subsidiary of Able Telcom, is projected to have revenues of $27-$30 million in fiscal 1997, Able said.
Georgia Electric, which specializes in intelligent highway systems like computerized traffic lights, has averaged pre-tax margins of up to 12 percent during the past five fiscal years.

Able Telcom said it had created a division called Traffic Management Services as a result of the acquisition. The division will consist of three traffic management companies -- Transportation Safety Contractors Inc, TSCI of Virginia and GEC.
Able Telcom installs telecommunications networks for telephone companies and provides highway signage, lighting and other traffic control systems.
